intro: Witheringia ciliata, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Witheringia ciliata is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
